item.title: Report E-2024070000
item.description:
Report E-2024070000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was punctured by fallen freight and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, neutralizers, granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the UN3265-impacted trailer floor, wooden slab, tote exterior and swept them up. AS deconstructed the wooden slab and conducted a gravity tote transfer into a new 330-gallon poly tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. The original tote was deconstructed with and collected into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024060686
item.description:
Report E-2024060686

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: SAN MARCOS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THIRTEEN AIR PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO THERMAL LABEL AND INVOICE STATING POWER BANK. UPON PACKAGE INSPECTION EACH OF THE THIRTEEN PACKAGES CONTAIN ONE COUNSEL MINI POWER BANK, 5000 MAH, 3.7V, 18.5WH. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN NON-USA DESTINATIONS: 1ZB50Y400412362896, 1ZB50Y400403817706, 1ZB50Y400404654863, 1ZB50Y400410295436, 1ZB50Y400407917654, 1ZB50Y400436969124, 1ZB50Y400432030733, 1ZB50Y400434754707, 1ZB50Y400404137476, 1ZB50Y400404369841, 1ZB50Y400435509113 and 1ZB50Y400436949940. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER BOXES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024061654
item.description:
Report X-2024061654

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: John Houle Operations Supervisor Stated while unloading trailer 660617. John stated while the forklift operator was unloading freight from the top of a pallet of UN1789, HYDROCHLORIC ACID SOLUTION,8, PG ll. John stated the freight fell off the forklift forks and fell on the pallet below and damaged a 1 gallon pail of the HYDROCHLORIC ACID SOLUTION and has spilled approximately 12 oz on the trailer floor. John stated the pallet has come apart and the pails fell over and some are damaged but not leaking from what he can see but was not sure due to the freight falling over in the trailer. ~

item.title: Report X-2024061578
item.description:
Report X-2024061578

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: PALMDALE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered during the morning sort and was brought to QA from Unload in a red container wrapped in a plastic bag. Box was inspected to be soiled at the top and corner of the package where 2 bottles appear to be missing some contents. Package appeared to have had a heavy weight on top which allowed for leakage of contents through the caps. The box also appears to have been crushed towards the bottom or dropped from a considerable height. Improper handling of package.

item.title: Report X-2024061595
item.description:
Report X-2024061595

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM THE OVERHEAD SORTER TORN OPEN AND WET. NO MARKINGS INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. SPIDR INDICATES THAT PACKAGE WAS INITIALLY DAMAGED AT RLTO OVERHEAD SORTER, DAMAGES EXACERBATED AS PACKAGE WAS INDUCTED INTO SACR OVERHEAD SORTER. ONE AEROSOL CAN WITH ONE INCH CUT ABOVE THE BASE. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024060608
item.description:
Report E-2024060608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN1263 RDL39LVOC1 BF USA release from a 44.40-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 30’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by the trailer wall. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060626
item.description:
Report E-2024060626

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was operating a forklift with a drum grabber attachment to load drums into a trailer. During this process, the employee observed an odor. The employee stopped operating the forklift and went to investigate the source of the odor. Further investigation revealed that a drum in the trailer was leaking from a small pin sized puncture in the middle of its body. Approximately one pint of the liquid chemical had leaked from the drum and released onto the trailer floor. The duration of the spill was less than 5 minutes. The employee removed the leaking drum from the trailer and placed it into a salvage drum with absorbent. The spill was cleaned up by two other Veolia employees that were on the premises.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package discovered while unloading trailer. Package was dry at that point, but presented visually as having been wet previously do to staining of carton. Package was contained in a lined HazMat tote. No packages in the vicinity of the damaged package were visually perceived to have been affected by the spill (or possible venting).

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 36600
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The GATX 8245 was reported leaking. Upon inspection of the car by the local Fire Department Hazmat team, the sample line valve was found in the open position with the plug not installed. The fire department closed the valve stopping the release. The plug was then installed into the valve body. Full waste manifest number...018353864FLE
